#Jittering initial values for combined model

Create an unfitted model and use random draws around default initial values for fitting.
.pull-left[
```{r, eval = FALSE}
temp <- fit_wham(input0_less, do.fit=F) 
set.seed(123)
jit.nll <- sapply(1:100, function(x){
	nlminb(rnorm(length(temp$par), mean = temp$par, sd = 0.1), temp$fn, temp$gr, control = list(iter.max = 1000, eval.max = 1000))$obj	
})
```
]

#Movement hypothesis:
```{r, echo = FALSE, out.width="80%", fig.align="center"}
knitr::include_graphics(here::here("docs","plots","migration_diagram_1.jpg"))
```
Currently:
* All Jan 1 recruitment for a given stock only in respective regions
* All North fish move back to their spawning region at end of season 5
* All North fish remain in spawning region until end of season 7
* Spawning season is only time when whole North population is in spawning region
* South population is only in South.

#Evidence for bottom temperature effects on recruitment

```{r, echo = F, eval = T}
library(TMB)
null_mod <- readRDS(here::here("2023.RT.Runs","Run33","fit_no_effect.RDS"))
sat_mod <- readRDS(here::here("2023.RT.Runs","Run33","fit_both_effects.RDS"))
Run30 <- readRDS(here::here("2023.RT.Runs","Run30","fit.RDS"))
Run33 <- readRDS(here::here("2023.RT.Runs","Run33","fit.RDS"))
#Run34_bad <- readRDS(here::here("2023.RT.Runs","Run34","fit.RDS"))
Run34 <- readRDS(here::here("2023.RT.Runs","Run34","fit.RDS"))
dat <- Run34$input$data
std <- summary(Run34$sdrep, "report")
ssb40_ind <- which(rownames(std) == "log_SSB_FXSPR_static")
ssb_ind <- which(rownames(std) == "log_SSB")
ssb_tot_ind <- which(rownames(std) == "log_SSB_all")
#exp(std[which(rownames(std) == "log_SSB_FXSPR_static"),1])
#sum(exp(std[which(rownames(std) == "log_SSB_FXSPR_static")[1:2],1]))
predR_ind <- which(rownames(std) == "log_SPR_FXSPR")
```

.pull-left[
```{r, echo = F, eval = T}
mods <- c("null_mod","Run33", "sat_mod")
AIC <- round(2*(sapply(mods, function(x) get(x)$opt$obj + length(get(x)$opt$par))), 2)
Rsig <- round(sapply(mods, function(x) exp(get(x)$parList$log_NAA_sigma[1,1,1])),2)
out <- cbind(AIC = AIC, "North $\\widehat{\\sigma}_R$" = Rsig)
rownames(out) <- c("No effect", "North temperature effect only", "Both temperature effects")
out <- kable(out, format = type, booktabs = T, escape=F, row.names = T,label = "compare-table",
    align = c(rep("r",2)))
knitr::knit_print(out)
#cat(knitr::knit_print(out))
```
]
.pull-right[
```{r, echo = F, eval = T}
out <- 2*(sapply(mods, function(x) c(
  get(x)$opt$obj + length(get(x)$opt$par),
  sapply(get(x)$peels, function(y) y$opt$obj + length(y$opt$par)))))
out <- as.data.frame(round(t(apply(out, 1, function(x) x - min(x))),2))
colnames(out) <- c("No effect", "North only", "North and South")
out <- cbind(Peel = 0:7, out)
out <- kable(out, format = type, booktabs = T, escape=F, row.names = F,label = "peel-compare-table",
    align = c(rep("r",4)))
knitr::knit_print(out)

```
]

# Equilibrium per recruit calculations


The $n_r \times n_r$ matrix of equilibrium spawning stock biomass per recruit for stock $s$ in region $r'$ (columns) given recruiting in region $r$ (rows) is defined as
$$\widetilde {\mathbf{O}}_s({\widetilde F}) = \sum^{A}_{a=1} \mathbf{O}_{s,a} \mathbf{O}_{s,a}(\delta_s) \text{diag}\left({\bf f}_{s,a}\right)$$

where $\mathbf{O}_{s,a}(\delta_s)$ is $n_r x n_r$ is the matrix of probabilities of surviving and occurring in region $r'$ at age $a+\delta_s$ given starting in region $r$ at age $a$. It is the upper left sub-matrix of the probability transition matrix defined over the same interval. Similarly,
$$\mathbf{O}_{s,a} = \left\{ \begin{array}{ll} \prod^{a-1}_{i=0}\mathbf{O}_{s,i}  & 1\leq a<A\\ \left[\prod^{a-1}_{i=0}\mathbf{O}_{s,i}\right] \mathbf{O}_{s,+} & a = A \end{array}\right.$$
is the upper left sub-matrix of the probability transition matrix of states at age $a$ (columns) given being in each state (rows) at recruitment (age 1) where $\mathbf{O}_{s,0} = {\bf I}$. For the plus group $a=A$, $\mathbf{O}_{s,+} = \left(\mathbf{I} - \mathbf{O}_{s,A}\right)^{-1}$ is a "fundamental matrix" derived using the matrix version of the  geometric series. $\mathbf{f}_{s,a}$ is the vector of fecundities (product of weight and maturity) at age $a$ in each region.

# Average FAA for black sea bass BRPs 

* Fishing mortality at age is averaged over last five years by fleet

```{r, echo = F, eval = T}
mod <- readRDS(here::here("2023.RT.Runs", "Run34", "fit_repmore.RDS"))
x <- round(mod$rep$FAA_static,2)
rownames(x) <- mod$input$fleet_names
colnames(x) <- mod$ages.lab
x <- knitr::kable(x, booktabs = T, escape=F, row.names = T)
knitr::knit_print(x)
```
---

# Selectivity for black sea bass BRPs 

* Average fishing mortality at age and fleet is divided by the maximum of the total average FAA.

```{r, echo = F, eval = T}
x <- round(apply(mod$rep$FAA_static,2,sum),2)
names(x) <- mod$ages.lab
x <- knitr::kable(rbind(x), booktabs = T, escape=F, row.names = F)
knitr::knit_print(x)
```
$$\\[12pt]$$
```{r, echo = F, eval = T}
x <- round(mod$rep$FAA_static/apply(mod$rep$FAA_static,2,sum)[8],2)
rownames(x) <- mod$input$fleet_names
colnames(x) <- mod$ages.lab
x <- knitr::kable(x, booktabs = T, escape=F, row.names = T)
knitr::knit_print(x)
```

# Proportions at age
```{r, echo = FALSE, fig.dim =c(8,5), fig.align="center"}
par(mfrow = c(1,2), oma = c(4,4,0,0),mar = c(1,2,3,1))
stock <- c("North", "South")
for(i in 1:2){
	propAA0 <- mod$rep$NAAPR0_static[i,,i,i]
	propAA0 <- propAA0/sum(propAA0)
	propAAF40 <- mod$rep$NAAPR_FXSPR_static[i,,i,i]
	propAAF40 <- propAAF40/sum(propAAF40)
	propAA_term <- mod$rep$NAA[i,i,33,]
	propAA_term <- propAA_term/sum(propAA_term)

	plot(1:8, propAA0, ylim = c(0,0.45), xaxt = "n", ylab = "", type = 'n', xlab = "")
	grid(col = gray(0.7))
	lines(1:8,propAA0)
	lines(1:8, propAAF40, lty = 2)
	lines(1:8, propAA_term, col = "blue")
	axis(1, at = 1:8, labels = mod$ages.lab)
	if(i == 1) legend("topright", legend = c("Equilibrium unfished", "Equilibrium at F40", "2021"), col = c("black","black", "blue"), lty = c(1,2,1))
	mtext(side = 3, stock[i], line = 0, outer = F)
}
mtext(side = 1, outer = T, "Age", line = 2.5)
mtext(side = 2, outer = T, "Proportion", line = 2.5)
```
